page.title: 09SOME BIRDS IN DOLPHINTON
page.content: The area of Dolphinton includes moorland coniferous/mixed woods farm and marshlands small loch providing habitat for migrant and resident birds of which more than 90 species have been identified including:- Ducks - Mallard Teal Goldeneye Tufted. Geese - This valley is one of the migrant routes between winter feeding and summer breeding grounds- large skeins of Greylag and Pinkfoot with an occasional Canada or Brent pass overhead in Spring or Autumn. Swans - None in this area for past 3 years, previously Mute nested on Loch. Bewicks Whooper were occasional migrant visitors. Gulls - black-backed black-headed Herring Common Gull. Heron Moorhen Coot Dabchick. Waders - Snipe Woodcock Lapwing Curlews Oystercatcher Reed Bunting Yellowhammer.
